title: Home and Away's Sam Frost looks downcast after Seven telethon
text:
Sam Frost appeared deep in thought as she made her way through Sydney Airport on Sunday.

The Home and Away star was returning from a brief trip to Perth, where she had participated in Channel Seven's telethon for sick children.

Strolling through the domestic terminal, Sam seemed downcast as she listened to music on her wireless Apple EarPods.

Scroll down for video

Lost in thought: Home and Away's Sam Frost appeared deep in thought as she made her way through Sydney Airport on Sunday

The former Bachelorette dressed casually for her flight, stepping out in black leggings and a matching jumper.

She also wore white sneakers and slung a backpack over her shoulders.

The 30-year-old was clutching a tabloid newspaper, which she'd likely obtained for free on her flight from WA.

For a good cause: Sam, 30, was returning from a brief trip to Perth, where she had participated in Channel Seven's telethon for sick children

Her blonde hair was tied back in a messy ponytail, drawing attention to her makeup-free complexion, and she also wore thick-framed glasses.

She flew back into Sydney with fellow Channel Seven star Sam Mac.

The Sunrise weatherman documented their trip on his Instagram Stories, sharing videos of the pair giggling and pouting for the camera.

In a world of her own: Strolling through the domestic terminal, Sam seemed downcast as she listened to music on her wireless Apple EarPods

Speaking to The West Australian on Sunday, Sam said she was thrilled to meet a six-year-old fan named Jade Martin, who suffers from a rare form of brain cancer.

'It was really heart warming, her family has so much strength and resilience, I think it's really inspiring, she's such a cool little girl who has the most beautiful smile and attitude,' she said.

Sam spoke about her own health issues earlier this month, telling The Daily Telegraph's body+soul she struggles with depression.

'I remember talking to my sister, Kristine, one night and I was so upset, I couldn't stop crying. I just felt like my whole body was riddled with pain and that there was no way I could make it go away,' she confessed.
description: Sam Frost appeared deep in thought as she made her way through Sydney Airport on Sunday.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
